data.source: Post-mortem motor cortex and spinal cord samples from ALS patients
Cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) from ALS patients and controls
Blood and plasma samples from sporadic and familial ALS patients
Blood and post-mortem neural tissue samples
Blood cells, serum, and CSF from ALS patients
EpiSwitch platform analysis on blood samples

analyses.analysis_name: Metabolomic Profiling for FALS vs SALS
Integrative Multi-Omics and Pathway Analysis for Molecular Classification

features: Mutations: SOD1 (oxidative stress), C9orf72 (repeat expansions), FUS (RNA processing), TARDBP (TDP-43 pathology), KIF5A (axonal transport), ATXN2 (age of onset modifier), SPAST (axonal transport), EPHA4 (survival modifier)
VEGFA, GDNF, IGFBP-2, IGFBP-3, IGFBP-5, FGF-2, HGF
IL2, IL4, IL5, IL6, IL-10, IL-13, IL-15, TNF, TNFRSF1A, IFNG, TGFB1
GFAP, CXCL10, SOD1, CHIT1, TARDBP, S100B

results.value: High sensitivity and specificity for differentiation
features: NF-L, pNFH, IL-10, IL-6, GM-CSF, IL-2, IL-15, IL-8, wrCRP, HMGB, GPNMB, UCHL1, bFGF, VGF

results.value: Distinct metabolomic profiles for FALS and SALS
features: Total cholesterol, LDL, LDL/HDL ratio, Triglycerides, High-density lipoprotein (HDL)
APOE, C9orf72, TARDBP, SOD1, FUS, TDP-43

results.value: Identified key features for integrative classification
features: Integrated pathways (e.g., RNA splicing, oxidative stress, inflammatory response, and proteostasis)
Combined biomarkers (e.g., histamine-related genes + miR-1234-3p + NEFL + pNFH + UCHL1 + C9orf72-associated Poly(GP))
